definition: to have a share of (responsibility etc)/to be concerned/to be involved
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
classifier for gifts, newspaper, magazine, papers, reports, contracts etc/variant of 分[fen4]

sentences.english: Leaf GongJin rediscovered the briefcase, but there is in a cloud of hair impeach him.
sentences.chinese: 葉公瑾找回了公文包，但裏頭有份程雲發檢舉他的信。

sentences.english: Over population, everyone has a job.
sentences.chinese: 人口過剩，但人人都有份工作。

sentences.english: “So we’re just happy to have jobs,” he adds.
sentences.chinese: “所以我們很高興還能有份工作，”他補充道。

sentences.english: It wasn't just junk-bond investors - banks drank the Kool-Aid too.
sentences.chinese: 這不僅僅關乎那些垃圾債券的投資者，銀行也有份。

sentences.english: I have the "New York Times", and fourteen dimes.
sentences.chinese: 我有份紐約時報，同十四角錢。

sentences.english: I had a job, on top of being a full-time student.
sentences.chinese: 我有份工作而且還是最重要的全日制學生呢。

sentences.english: Nina tells him that Jamey has confessed to her participation in the plot.
sentences.chinese: 尼娜告訴他，傑克已經招認了有份參與這個陰謀。

sentences.english: I. Believers are called to be partakers of His divine nature.
sentences.chinese: 神呼召基督徒要成爲基督神性的有份者。

definition: lots of money, less work, and close to home/ideal job
pinyin: qian2 duo1 shi4 shao3 li2 jia1 jin4

definition: in order to/because of/for the sake of
(to play) one's part/one's role/one's duty/(to stay within) one's bounds/dutiful/keeping to one's role
content with one's situation/to know contentment (hence happiness)
